articleinfo.title: Orocos 0.18.1 Release Series Changes, New Features, and Fixes

article.para: This document provides a quick overview of what changed between Orocos 0.18.0 and Orocos 0.18.1. If your application does not work, look here for possible causes and solutions. Also feature additions and improvements are documented.
See also what changed from 0.16.0 to 0.18.0.

listitem.para: The build system has yet more improved automake support. The traditional make install and make uninstall targets work as expected with default values. The default install path is /usr/local/orocos, which can be changed using configure --prefix=

Orocos now builds by default with the OROSEM_OS_ANGOSTIC flag which is defined in the configtool's OS package. This option causes that no OS system calls are inlined, and thus that all installed header files are OS-independent, and that the library contains all target-specific function calls.

Upon installation, a liborocos-<target>.a is created in the lib directory, such that you do not need to specify the literal -ltarget link flag but, for example -lorocos-lxrt. The two libraries can only coexist in OS_AGNOSTIC mode or when Orocos is installed in separate directories.
The Property system's update() and copy() methods are executed in bounded time. A bug did dynamic_casts in previous versions.
The Event system's asynchronous fire( args ) methods are executed in bounded time. A bug did a memory allocation in previous versions.
Orocos State Descriptions and Program Scripts can be fully controlled on the script level. The reset(), step() and pause() commands were missing in 0.18.0.
Loading and unloading of programs and states is cleaner, and does no longer cause errors if a program or state is unloaded and loaded again.
Various bugs were fixed in the KernelClient 0.2 and a README file is provided for quick instructions. A package with version number 0.3 has been made.

appendix.para: Please send general, non technical, Orocos questions to orocos@mail.mech.kuleuven.ac.be .
These pages are maintained by the Orocos team.

For questions related to the use of the Orocos Software, please consult these web pages and the Orocos manuals. If that fails, the orocos-dev@mail.mech.kuleuven.ac.be mailing list might help. Please send comments on these web pages and the development of Orocos to our developer mailing list at orocos-dev@mail.mech.kuleuven.ac.be . All of our lists have public archives.
